text: <@U02EH80E74Z> Code looks fine. Quick test shows both functions in the DOM, and both are working. I guess the Problem is elsewhere. Are you sure, the local files are synchronized? Did you checked directly in the Design-Manager? Maybe a problem with the revision number.

thanks for the reply <@UK9BKNBD5>
js files are going through a build process before being uploaded through the CLI, but when I check the dist folder, file getting uploaded by the CLI is exactly as described above.

When I make changes to the file, they are actually reflected correctly in Design tools and finally on the website.
So when I change the actual string in the first console.log statement, I will end up with that new line of code in the minified module.js file.
I triple-checked that because at first I thought it might be some sort of caching issue on the server, as I’ve ran into similar problems before.

There’s no need to put anything specific in meta.json to make the module.js file work correctly is there?

The module.js should work out of the box, none specific here. But maybe its the Build process, that could remove unused functions. So maybe you have to call the function anywhere, after declaring. (as part of minimization)
nope, for module.js files it’s just piping them over to the dist folder. I checked, files are there, untouched/unaltered.
also, when checking in Design Tools, it’s showing me the correct contents of the module.js file
okay, so now uploading file again it has worked
frustrating, working with a proprietary backend server that you have no way to run locally or do any debugging on

so yeah I was too quick, it’s not working.
still only getting the console log
